description: The House passed a bill Monday to protect business owners who do not want to provide services for same-sex couples.
title: Indiana: Exemption for Service to Gays Advances
title_page: Indiana: Exemption for Service to Gays Advances - The New York Times
text: The House passed a bill Monday to protect business owners who do not want to provide services for same-sex couples. A version was previously passed by the Republican-controlled Senate, and Gov. Mike Pence, a Republican, has indicated support for it. Supporters say it will prevent people such as bakers and florists from being forced to act contrary to their religious beliers. Opponents called it a “religious discrimination bill” that would allow discrimination against gay people and others on religious grounds.
